newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares firm, seen drifting.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares firm, seen drifting.

text.p: Slovenian shares firmed 0.57 percent on Tuesday and traders said prices and volumes would most likely stagnate over the short-term due to a lack of fresh trading incentives.
But some hold out hope for a recovery, fuelled by bottom-fishing.
"A lack of demand this last month pushed prices to their current levels. This is a very good time for long-term investors to buy some shares," Robert Rudolf, a trader at brokerage Moja Delnica said.
* The SBI index rose 7.24 points to 1,281.5.
* Overall 10 shares rose, five fell and one was unchanged, while 10 were untraded.
* Bank SKB was the most actively traded, firming 4.01 percent to 49,250 tolars on volume of 375 shares. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
